article.description: Allen Crabbe scored 24 points, Justin Cobbs added 20, and California pulled away in the final 6 minutes to beat Pacific 78-58 on Sunday to win the DirecTV Classic.
article.shortLinkText: Cal tears up Pacific to claim DirecTV Classic
article.headline: Cal easily beats Pacific to win DirecTV Classic
article.linkText: Cal easily beats Pacific to win DirecTV Classic

inlines.body:
DIRECTV Classic

The 2012 DIRECTV Classic features teams like California, Georgia Tech and Saint Mary's battling for an early-season title. ESPN.com Topics has full coverage. Topics page »

article.story: ANAHEIM, Calif. -- Allen Crabbe scored 24 points, Justin Cobbs added 20, and California pulled away in the final 6 minutes to beat Pacific 78-58 on Sunday to win the DirecTV Classic. The Golden Bears, who are off to their first 6-0 start 2007, were 22 for 25 on free throws. Cal leads 26-2 in the all-time series between the Northern California schools. Ross Rivera scored 13 points for Pacific (3-3), which shot 34.4 percent and went 3 of 17 from 3-point range. Shooting guard Sama Taku missed all eight of his shots after going 16 of 32 from the field over his previous four games. Trailing by 14 points at halftime, Pacific rallied within 53-45 after Trevin Harris was fouled by Crabbe on a 3-point shot and sank all three free throws. Lorenzo McCloud triggered a 6-0 spurt by the Tigers and Khalil Kelley's jump-hook narrowed the gap to 59-54.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.
